key.name: first-start
key.description: If it's the first start of the application.

key.name: max-concurrent-downloads
key.description: Set maximum number of parallel downloads for every static (HTTP/FTP) URI, torrent and metalink.

key.name: max-overall-download-limit
key.description: Set max overall download speed in bytes/sec. 0 means unrestricted.

key.name: max-overall-upload-limit
key.description: Set max overall upload speed in bytes/sec. 0 means unrestricted.

key.name: max-connection-per-server
key.description: The maximum number of connections to one server for each download.

key.name: all-proxy
key.description: Use this proxy server for all protocols. To erase previously defined proxy, use "". You can override this setting and specify a proxy server for a particular protocol using http-proxy, https-proxy and ftp-proxy options. This affects all URIs. The format of PROXY is [http://][USER:PASSWORD@]HOST[:PORT].

key.name: connect-timeout
key.description: Set the connect timeout in seconds to establish connection to HTTP/FTP/proxy server. After the connection is established, this option makes no effect and timeout option is used instead.

key.name: timeout
key.description: Set timeout in seconds.

key.name: split
key.description: Download a file using N connections. If more than N URIs are given, first N URIs are used and remaining URIs are used for backup. If less than N URIs are given, those URIs are used more than once so that N connections total are made simultaneously. The number of connections to the same host is restricted by max-connection-per-server option. Please see min-split-size option too. Please note that in Metalink download, this option has no effect and use -C option instead.

key.name: min-split-size
key.description: Yaner does not split less than 2*SIZE byte range. For example, let’s consider downloading 20MiB file. If SIZE is 10M, Yaner can split file into 2 range [0-10MiB) and [10MiB-20MiB) and download it using 2 sources(if split >= 2, of course). If SIZE is 15M, since 2*15M > 20MiB, Yaner does not split file and download it using 1 source. Possible Values: 1-1024

key.name: auto-file-renaming
key.description: Rename file name if the same file already exists. This option works only in HTTP(S)/FTP download. The new file name has a dot and a number(1..9999) appended.

key.name: seed-time
key.description: Specify seeding time in minutes. Also see the seed-ratio option. Specifying seed-time=0 disables seeding after download completed.

key.name: seed-ratio
key.description: Specify share ratio. Seed completed torrents until share ratio reaches RATIO. You are strongly encouraged to specify equals or more than 1.0 here. Specify 0.0 if you intend to do seeding regardless of share ratio. If --seed-time option is specified along with this option, seeding ends when at least one of the conditions is satisfied.

key.name: bt-max-open-files
key.description: Specify maximum number of files to open in each BitTorrent download.

key.name: bt-max-peers
key.description: Specify the maximum number of peers per torrent. 0 means unlimited.

key.name: bt-tracker-connect-timeout
key.description: Set the connect timeout in seconds to establish connection to tracker. After the connection is established, this option makes no effect and bt-tracker-timeout option is used instead.

key.name: bt-tracker-timeout
key.description: Set timeout in seconds.

key.name: bt-prioritize-piece
key.description: Try to download first and last pieces of each file first. This is useful for previewing files. The argument can contain 2 keywords: head and tail. To include both keywords, they must be separated by comma. These keywords can take one parameter, SIZE. For example, if head=SIZE is specified, pieces in the range of first SIZE bytes of each file get higher priority. tail=SIZE means the range of last SIZE bytes of each file. SIZE can include K or M(1K = 1024, 1M = 1024K). If SIZE is omitted, SIZE=1M is used.

key.name: metalink-language
key.description: The language of the file to download.

key.name: metalink-location
key.description: The location of the preferred server. A comma-delimited list of locations is acceptable, for example, jp,us.

key.name: metalink-os
key.description: The operating system of the file to download.

key.name: metalink-version
key.description: The version of the file to download.

key.name: http-user
key.description: Set HTTP user. This affects all URIs.

key.name: http-passwd
key.description: Set HTTP password. This affects all URIs.

key.name: ftp-user
key.description: Set FTP user. This affects all URIs.

key.name: ftp-passwd
key.description: Set FTP password. This affects all URIs. If user name is embedded but password is missing in URI, Yaner tries to resolve password using .netrc. If password is found in .netrc, then use it as password. If not, use the password specified in this option.

key.name: referer
key.description: Set Referer. This affects all URIs.

key.name: allow-overwrite
key.description: Restart download from scratch if the corresponding control file doesn’t exist.

key.name: header
key.description: Append HEADER to HTTP request header.

key.name: user-agent
key.description: Set user agent for HTTP(S) downloads.

key.name: max-download-limit
key.description: Set max download speed per each download in bytes/sec. 0 means unrestricted.

key.name: max-upload-limit
key.description: Set max upload speed per each upload in bytes/sec. 0 means unrestricted.

key.name: max-tries
key.description: Set number of tries. 0 means unlimited.

key.name: bt-tracker-interval
key.description: Set the interval in seconds between tracker requests. This completely overrides interval value and Yaner just uses this value and ignores the min interval and interval value in the response of tracker. If 0 is set, Yaner determines interval based on the response of tracker and the download progress.

key.name: retry-wait
key.description: Set the seconds to wait between retries. With SEC > 0, Yaner will retry download when the HTTP server returns 503 response.
